content:
A couple of chats have surfaced an issue with the interpretation of binding and DAR and real world implementability.

  • https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179175-argonaut
  • https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179166-implementers/topic/Aligning.20with.20FHIR.20resource.20states

bottom line is if we accept Lloyd's assertion whether factually correct or not - it removes an important mechanism if the data is simply not there. I would like to discuss further on the fhir-I call (unless MnM more appropriate).
MnM's probably more appropriate, but we'll get more people on FHIR-I
